alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Leslie, southeastern Jackson and northern Clay Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Laurel Creek, or near Manchester, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Enline, Brutus and Peabody around 925 PM EDT. Jacks Creek, Panco, Sizerock, Bear Branch, Bobs Fork, Big Creek and Marcum around 930 PM EDT. Thousandsticks, Kaliopi and Hosea around 935 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hyden, Dryhill, Toulouse, Wendover and Stinnett. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 18, between mile markers 20 and 21, and between mile markers 23 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
